channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuela debates sweeping amnesty for political prisoners
item.description: After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.
item.content:encoded:
After the fall of Nicolás Maduro, the Venezuelan regime promise amnesty and reconciliation — but for hundreds still jailed and thousands facing charges, justice remains uncertain.

(Image credit: Ariana Cubillos)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Will the transatlantic alliance survive?
item.description: U.S. Senators Jeanne Shaheen, D-N.H., and Thom Tillis, R-N.C., co-chairs of the bipartisan Senate NATO Observer Group, sit down with NPR's Mary Louise Kelly at the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: U.S. Senators Jeanne Shaheen, D-N.H., and Thom Tillis, R-N.C., co-chairs of the bipartisan Senate NATO Observer Group, sit down with NPR's Mary Louise Kelly at the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Karen Zamora

item.title: Britain's High Court says government illegally banned Pro-Palestinian group
item.description: In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."
item.content:encoded:
In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who will police Gaza, and how?
item.description: Under President Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan, Arab countries and the European Union are supposed to train a new police force in the Gaza Strip. But U.S. plans have run into serious challenges.
item.content:encoded:
Under President Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan, Arab countries and the European Union are supposed to train a new police force in the Gaza Strip. But U.S. plans have run into serious challenges.

(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: World leaders to discuss the future of Europe's security in Munich
item.description: World leaders will meet at the Munich Security Conference Friday to discuss the future of Europe's security.
item.content:encoded: World leaders will meet at the Munich Security Conference Friday to discuss the future of Europe's security.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: Members of Germany's far-right party to attend Munich Security Conference after ban
item.description: Members of Germany's far-right AfD Party were banned from attending the Munich Security Conference. On Friday, they'll attend for the first time in years.
item.content:encoded: Members of Germany's far-right AfD Party were banned from attending the Munich Security Conference. On Friday, they'll attend for the first time in years.
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: A historic election in Bangladesh brings BNP to power. What to know about its leader
item.description: The Bangladeshi Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, claimed victory Friday in the first elections held since the previous government was toppled in a student-led revolution in 2024.
item.content:encoded:
The Bangladeshi Nationalist Party (BNP), led by Tarique Rahman, claimed victory Friday in the first elections held since the previous government was toppled in a student-led revolution in 2024.

(Image credit: Mahmud Hossain Opu)
item.dc:creator: Shamim Chowdhury

item.title: Israel accuses two of using military secrets to place Polymarket bets
item.description: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.
item.content:encoded: The Tel Aviv indictment is the first publicly known instance of people being accused of leveraging military secrets to place bets on the popular prediction market.
item.dc:creator: Bobby Allyn

item.title: How U.S. sanctions played into the protests in IRan
item.description: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?
item.content:encoded: The protests in Iran have been about human rights, corruption, freedom — but they were sparked by economic hardship, caused in part by U.S. sanctions. How did they play into the events in Iran?
item.dc:creator: Mary Childs

item.title: Germany's far right political party, the AFD, is at the Munich Security Conference
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly and Correspondent Rob Schmitz discuss Germany's far-right Alternative for Germany, or AfD, at to the Munich Security Conference.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly
